sentence.text: Hepatocellular carcinoma (phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation) is known as a highly prevalent cancer with a poor prognosis and short survival time, despite intensive research and clinical efforts.
Here, we report that the expression of microRNA-493 (protein polyubiquitination-493) is decreased in phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation cell lines and in tumor tissues.

Overexpression of protein polyubiquitination-493 in phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation cells dramatically inhibited cell proliferation and colony-formation in vitro and inhibited tumor formation of HCC cell xenografts in vivo.

Novel targets actin cytoskeleton reorganization and positive regulation of Wnt signaling pathway were confirmed to be suppressed by protein polyubiquitination-493 directly, and overexpression of ANTXR1 and RSPO2 could restore tumorigenesis in miR-493 treated phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation cell.

entity.text: positive regulation of Wnt signaling pathway

sentence.text: Moreover, Wnt/Î²-catenin signaling pathway, which was reported to be activated by actin cytoskeleton reorganization and positive regulation of Wnt signaling pathway, was also inhibited by protein polyubiquitination-493 overexpression and might be involved in anti-tumor function of miR-493.

entity.text: positive regulation of Wnt signaling pathway

sentence.text: These findings suggest that protein polyubiquitination-493 acts as a negative regulator in hepatocellular carcinoma progression and may be a potential therapeutic target for HCC
